featured.text: Who gave the name “the Swiss army knife” to the knife discussed in the passage? (A) Carl Elsener.
In 1884, Carl Elsener, head of the Swiss knife manufacturer Victorinox, seized that opportunity with both hands, and designed a soldier’s knife that the army loved.

definition.zh_def: 一種特定的姓氏，通常與某些地區或家族有關。
definition.en_def: A specific surname often associated with certain regions or families.
definition.example: The famous artist, Elsener, showcased his work at the gallery.
